John Smith wrote:
> 
> Even in the JUnit FAQ they use assertTrue(true).
> 
> http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#tests_9
> 
> The editors of this FAQ should not write such an example.
> 
> If Beck and Gamma would recommend using assertTrue(true), they would 
> have added a method like pass() or succeed() to TestCase.

The JUnit FAQ writers differ in opinion. I don't think that one or the 
other is /wrong/, but rather points to differences in what we find easy 
to read. I have found out the hard way that some people find my code 
unclear, even though I can "defend" why it should be clear. At some 
point, there's no accounting for taste.
-- 
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
